Issues.Title: Infinite loop in shared.ts
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug? animations ### Is this a regression? ~No~ Yes ### Description Due to an extremely unlikely (but not too unlikely!) coincidence, the Angular animation module stucked in an infinite loop. This occured inside `containsElement(elm1, elm2)`: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/18.1.3/packages/animations/browser/src/render/shared.ts#L204 because of how `getParentElement(element)` is implemented: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/18.1.3/packages/animations/browser/src/render/shared.ts#L159. There are just [3 relevant files](https://github.com/perceptron8/quirk/tree/master/src/app) in the linked repository. The rest was generated with `ng new` using default settings (with the exception of routing, which I disabled). The most important part seems to be `AppComponent`'s template: ```html @if (true) {
} ``` 1. `p-overlay` is some meaningless component using `animations: []` (see [overlay.ts](https://github.com/perceptron8/quirk/blob/master/src/app/overlay.ts)), 2. It's sibling, `input` identified as `"host"`, is enclosed inside a `form`, 3. Initially `form` seems to have no `parentElement` because of `@if` (same would be true if `*ngIf` was used). All of the above had to appear for this bug to occur: element using animations, `input` with id (or name) equal to 'host' and a `form` inside control flow block. Then, `getParentElement` gets no `element.parentNode` because of (3.) and falls back to `element.host`. Next, because of (2.), `element.host` refers to `input` instead of nothing (as form is not so much of a custom element). Finally, there is (1.), which makes `containsElement` being called in the first place. --- It seems to me, that it may be sufficient to change `getParentElement` so it uses `.host` access more carefully (i.e. conditionally). --- Please note, that the current implementation will also fail for `` inside a control block as `a` also has `host` property (see https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Location/host). ```html @if (true) { } ``` In this case however, there will be no infinite loop, as `a`'s `host`, being a `String` equal to`"angular.dev"`, has neither `parentNode` nor `host`. Still, parent element doesn't really seem to be determined correctly. --- Some hopefully useful spec links: - https://dom.spec.whatwg.org/#dom-shadowroot-host - https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/forms.html#dom-form-nameditem ### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug https://github.com/perceptron8/quirk ### Please provide the exception or error you saw ```true Browser's tab freezes with 100% CPU usage. ``` ### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`) ```true Angular CLI: 18.1.3 Node: 22.3.0 Package Manager: npm 10.8.1 OS: linux x64 Angular: ... Package Version ------------------------------------------------------ @angular-devkit/architect 0.1801.3 (cli-only) @angular-devkit/core 18.1.3 (cli-only) @angular-devkit/schematics 18.1.3 (cli-only) @schematics/angular 18.1.3 (cli-only) ``` ### Anything else? If you disable animations (globally in `ApplicationConfig` or locally in `Overlay`) _or_ change `input`'s id to something else than `"host"` _or_ remove `@if` wrapper, this crazy bug dissapears.

Issues.Title: a new function to retrieve local source entry  (for debugging)
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

_No response_

### Description

I propose a function that would return from where it was called.
An output alike 'main.ts functionxy r43' where the row number refers to the start of the function or observable or class or ...'  

I think the request is simple, currently there is no way to tell from within a running application to tell where its from.
Sure one can do console.log ('main.ts my function', myMessage)  is a workaround.

However imagine yourself a large application in an angular upgrade.
And each function/method observable etc requires a handwritten line to tell the origin.
. ..Its the way how i currently do it.. and it's cumbersome.

I have created a public [debug library for Angular and RXJS ](https://github.com/PGTBoos/RxJs-Debug.ts)
in which one now might add  identification location string as a possible overload, for a group of debug functions.
But it's not elegant, i have tried to get such info in other ways as well, but none really worked in all cases, and most worked not at all. This information isn't available once the code is compiled, it becomes a java blob.




### Proposed solution

a string function that upon build
keeps track of function names and observable names, and generates a short identification with at least the filename and origin in that file preferably also with a row number of the function.

### Alternatives considered

use a const in every function that you want to log
This may sounds as sure why not.. till you do large application and try to debug rxjs within your app.

### Command

serve

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

17.3.4

### Description

I'm encountering an issue where ng serve fails to build and serve my Angular application when I use the @import directive in the index.html file. This behavior is unexpected as the @import rule is a standard CSS mechanism.

### Minimal Reproduction

1. Create a new project with `ng new` (using Sass (SCSS))
2. Add the following piece of code to the `head` tag in the `index.html` file
```
  <style>
    @import url('./styles.css');
  </style>
```
3. Run `ng serve`

### Exception or Error

```text
Unable to resolve `@import "./styles.css"` from `my-path`
[vite] Internal server error: [postcss] ENOENT: no such file or directory, open './styles.css'

```

### Command

### Description

I am excited about the new loader import attribute option enabled by https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/commit/24aaf1e37f49735ce97fe72fced3d53b51d6b631

Unfortunately, the karma builder can't deal with the syntax yet and produces an error like this:
```
> ng test --no-watch --browsers=ChromeHeadless

- Generating browser application bundles (phase: setup)...
✔ Browser application bundle generation complete.

./src/app/app.component.ts - Error: Module build failed (from ./node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/tools/babel/webpack-loader.js):
SyntaxError: /home/runner/work/import-attribute/import-attribute/src/app/app.component.ts: Support for the experimental syntax 'importAttributes' isn't currently enabled (7:54):

   5 | import { RouterOutlet } from '@angular/router';
   6 | // @ts-expect-error TypeScript cannot provide types based on attributes yet
>  7 | import configFileContent from './app.config.ts' with { loader: 'text' };
     |                                                      ^
   8 | let AppComponent = class AppComponent {
   9 |     title = 'import-attribute';
  10 |     constructor() {
```

Issues.Title: Improve visibility of "Re-optimizing dependencies because lockfile has changed" state
Issues.Body:
### Command

serve

### Description

If you server an app for the first time, and it has a substantial size of libraries, you get this experience

- Building...
- Application bundle generation complete. and browser opens
- Browser shows a blank page for a few seconds, and nothing happens
- After a few seconds, the app loads normally

This is the output:

```
Application bundle generation complete. [8.275 seconds]

Watch mode enabled. Watching for file changes...
NOTE: Raw file sizes do not reflect development server per-request transformations.
Re-optimizing dependencies because lockfile has changed
  ➜  Local:   http://localhost:4200/
  ➜  press h + enter to show help
```

If you don't pay very close attention, you might not see the "Re-optimizing" line. And even if you do, you don't necessarily link it to your page not loading, because it just says something about "re-optimizing", which does not sound like it's a mandatory build step. After all, there already was the output "bundle generation complete".

-> it just looks like your app is broken, and you start opening the devtools to figure out what went wrong.

### Describe the solution you'd like

I think it would be good if `ng serve` stayed in the "Building" phase while dependencies are "optimized" the first time, so that the app immediately loads when it opens in the browser.

Issues.Title: Bundle order causes components to be undefined with `build-angular:application`
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

compiler

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

I have created a circular dependency in my project. (I know it isn't best practice to do so.)

This circular dependency causes the `DefaultDashboardComponent` to be emitted after the `dashboard-modules:DASHBOARD_MODULES` array. Which then causes the component to be undefined in this initial array.

```mermaid
graph TD
  dashboard-modules:DASHBOARD_MODULES --> DefaultDashboardComponent;
  DefaultDashboardComponent --> DashboardEndpointsService;
  DashboardEndpointsService --> dashboard-modules:findDashboardNavByKey;
  dashboard-modules:findDashboardNavByKey --> dashboard-modules:DASHBOARD_MODULES;
```

Using the older `@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser` builder didn't suffer from this problem.

Issues.Title: bug(MatSliderRangeThumb): Doesn't update correctly
Issues.Body:
### Description

After updating `min`, `max`, `matSliderStartThumb` and `matSliderEndThumb` values range slider is not displayed correctly. [Here](https://stackblitz.com/edit/stackblitz-starters-vmssmh?file=src%2Fmain.ts) is the Stackblitz example.

In the example I have range slider and button that toggles multiplying all values (min, max, from, to) by 100. After clicking the button range slider is not displayed with correct values.
I thought that maybe it's because for example `matSliderStartThumb` value is updated before `min`, `max` or `matSliderEndThumb`, but I made `aStart` (see Stackblitz example) computed value that depends on `aEnd` so that it's updated last. Console logs proves that this is the case:
```
MIN: 100
MAX: 1000
END: 600
START: 400
```
So what's the problem here?

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/stackblitz-starters-vmssmh?file=src%2Fmain.ts
Steps to reproduce:
1. Click "MULTIPLY BY 100" button
2. Check range slider displayed values
3. Check console logs

### Expected Behavior

Range slider values are updated correctly.

### Actual Behavior

Range slider values are not updated correctly.

### Environment

- Angular: ^18.0.0
- CDK/Material: ^18.1.2
- Browser(s): Chrome
